posts.post_content: Before the ownership rule changed, I wanted to build a deck where I gave someone some creature tokens (which I owned) using a Ravnica [hunted creature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=83573) and then [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=153973) my Bronze Bombshell. It would've been very slow and impractical but also funny as hell. I was excited about [Endless Whispers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=50129) until I noticed that the creature doesn't come back until end of turn (not immediately).
posts.html:

Posted By: Geraume (11/17/2012 6:33:37 AM)

posts.post_content:
Gentlemen, the ultimate combo (hilarious in multiplayer):  
  
Have a Bronze Bombshell on the field that you own.  
Tap all your lands. Be sure to make it seem like you aren't doing it for any particular reason. You'll need mana for later.  
Cast Thieves' Auction and take all their non-creatures, while they greedily take each others Eldrazi or other ridiculous creatures. Nobody will want to take your Bombshell, which is fine. Take it back for yourself if you suspect someone is on to your plan.  
After the entire board has had its creatures shuffled, cast Mirrorweave.  
Target the Bronze Bombshell you own with Mirrorweave.  
Sit back while all the powerful creatures people stole from each other explode.
posts.html:
Gentlemen, the ultimate combo (hilarious in multiplayer):

Have a Bronze Bombshell on the field that you own.
Tap all your lands. Be sure to make it seem like you aren't doing it for any particular reason. You'll need mana for later.
Cast Thieves' Auction and take all their non-creatures, while they greedily take each others Eldrazi or other ridiculous creatures. Nobody will want to take your Bombshell, which is fine. Take it back for yourself if you suspect someone is on to your plan.
After the entire board has had its creatures shuffled, cast Mirrorweave.
Target the Bronze Bombshell you own with Mirrorweave.
Sit back while all the powerful creatures people stole from each other explode.
